wan12.title: A three-step floating catchment area method for analyzing spatial access to health services
wan12.journal: International Journal of Geographical Information Science

bii21.title: catchment: Calculate spatial access and availability metrics

hhs:hospitals_per_100k.short_description: Number of hospital beds per 100k people.
hhs:hospitals_per_100k.long_description: Number of hospital beds per 100k people, based on 3-step floating catchment areas defined by distance. Catchment areas were calculated using (a) hospitals as listed by the U.S. Health and Human Services, with number of beds (overall average of 7 day averages) as supply values, (b) Census block groups, with supply values as the total population as reported the American Community Survey 5-year summaries, and (c) distance between hospital locations and block group centroids, weighted by a Gaussian function with a scaling parameter set to 18, as calculated by the catchment R package.
hhs:hospitals_per_100k.statement: There are {value} hospital beds per 100k people in {features.name}.

sources.name: U.S. Department of Health & Human Services
sources.location: Hospital > COVID-19 Reported Patient Impact and Hospital Capacity by Facility

hhs:intensive_care_per_100k.long_name: Intensive care unit beds per 100k people
hhs:intensive_care_per_100k.short_description: Number of Intensive care unit beds per 100k people.
hhs:intensive_care_per_100k.long_description: Number of Intensive care unit beds per 100k people, based on 3-step floating catchment areas defined by distance. Catchment areas were calculated using (a) hospitals with intensive care unit beds as listed by the U.S. Health and Human Services, with number of intensive care unit beds (overall average of 7 day averages) as supply values, (b) Census block groups, with supply values as the total population as reported the American Community Survey 5-year summaries, and (c) distance between hospital locations and block group centroids, weighted by a Gaussian function with a scaling parameter set to 18, as calculated by the catchment R package.
hhs:intensive_care_per_100k.statement: There are {value} intensive care unit beds per 100k people in {features.name}.

sources.name: U.S. Department of Health & Human Services
sources.location: Hospital > COVID-19 Reported Patient Impact and Hospital Capacity by Facility

hhs:childrens_hospitals_per_100k.short_description: Number of children's hospital beds per 100k people.
hhs:childrens_hospitals_per_100k.long_description: Number of children's hospital beds per 100k people, based on 3-step floating catchment areas defined by distance. Catchment areas were calculated using (a) children's hospitals as listed by the U.S. Health and Human Services, with number of beds (overall average of 7 day averages) as supply values, (b) Census block groups, with supply values as the total population as reported the American Community Survey 5-year summaries, and (c) distance between hospital locations and block group centroids, weighted by a Gaussian function with a scaling parameter set to 18, as calculated by the catchment R package.
hhs:childrens_hospitals_per_100k.statement: There are {value} children's hospital beds per 100k people in {features.name}.

sources.name: U.S. Department of Health & Human Services
sources.location: Hospital > COVID-19 Reported Patient Impact and Hospital Capacity by Facility

hhs:hospitals_min_drivetime.short_description: Drive time to the nearest hospital.
hhs:hospitals_min_drivetime.long_description: Minimal drive time to a hospital from the Census block group centroid, as calculated by the Open Source Routing Machine in 2022. Hospital locations are from the U.S. Health and Human Services. All distances are calculated at the block group level, then averaged up to higher-level geographies.
hhs:hospitals_min_drivetime.statement: It takes {value} to drive to a hospital from {features.name}'s block group centroids on average.

sources.name: U.S. Department of Health & Human Services
sources.location: Hospital > COVID-19 Reported Patient Impact and Hospital Capacity by Facility

hhs:intensive_care_min_drivetime.long_name: Drive time to nearest hospital with intensive care unit beds
hhs:intensive_care_min_drivetime.short_description: Drive time to the nearest hospital with intensive care unit beds.
hhs:intensive_care_min_drivetime.long_description: Minimal drive time to a hospital with intensive care unit beds from the Census block group centroid, as calculated by the Open Source Routing Machine in 2022. Hospital locations are from the U.S. Health and Human Services. All distances are calculated at the block group level, then averaged up to higher-level geographies.
hhs:intensive_care_min_drivetime.statement: It takes {value} to drive to a hospital with intensive care unit beds from {features.name}'s block group centroids on average.

hhs:childrens_hospitals_min_drivetime.long_description: Minimal drive time to a children's hospital from the Census block group centroid, as calculated by the Open Source Routing Machine in 2022. Hospital locations are from the U.S. Health and Human Services. All distances are calculated at the block group level, then averaged up to higher-level geographies.

hosp_near_10_median.long_name: Hospital availability by median drive time to the ten closest facilities in minutes
hosp_near_10_median.short_description: Median drive time (minutes) to the ten closest hospitals
hosp_near_10_median.long_description: Median drive time in minutes to the ten closest hospitals. Facility location data were collected from the Center for Medicare and Medicaid Services. Drive times were computed using Open Source Routing Machine (Using roads for year 2021).
hosp_near_10_median.statement: The median drive time to the ten closest hospitals to {features.name} is {value}.

sources.name: Center for Medicare and Medicaid Services

hosp_3sfca.long_name: Hospital geographic availability (3-step floating catchment areas)
hosp_3sfca.short_description: Index of hospital availability based on supply and demand of facilities
hosp_3sfca.long_description: Hospital access score based on 3-step floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of facilities per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a facility is accessible). Weights are defined for the demand for facilities (adult population).
hosp_3sfca.statement: The hospital geographic availability score for {features.name} is {value}.

sources.name: Center for Medicare and Medicaid Services

hosp_cnt.short_description: Count of hospitals based on facility locations
hosp_cnt.long_description: Count of hospitals based on facility locations. Location data were collected from the Center for Medicare and Medicaid Services.

sources.name: Center for Medicare and Medicaid Services
